You have a certain number of each letter from 'a' to 'z'.  You want to build a string of length $n$ using these letters, where you can use each letter at most $c_i$ times ($c_i$ is the number of times you can use the $i$-th letter).

A string is considered "beautiful" if it doesn't have any palindromic substrings of odd length greater than 1.  

Find the number of different "beautiful" strings you can build, and give the answer modulo 998244353.

You have a limited number of each letter of the alphabet. You need to build a string of a specific length using these letters, without using any letter more times than you have available.  A string is valid if it doesn't contain any palindromes (words that read the same backward as forward) longer than 1 character, except for the string itself.  Count how many valid strings you can make.
